content.description: From Kaweah Gap, scramble cross-country south towards the E/NE Face. There is a grassy ramp which can be hiked, or just use the broad East Face bowl. This is also the easiest way up and down the peak.
content.protection: Good scrambling shoes. A beginner party could take a rope and a light rack and pitch out some sections.
content.location: East Face of Eagle Scout Peak.

content.description:
from Secor's Peaks Passes & Trails 3rd edition:

"Begin by climbing the gully that is immediately to the right of the prominent north rib of the peak. Go up and right for six pitches of 5.6 and 5.7, reaching the ridge about 100 feet left of the summit block."
content.protection: alpine rack. singles, some doubles. one 60m. approach shoes for descent.
content.location:
After reaching Precipice Lake walk around it on the right and go up for 30-45 mins. onto a hump of granite until you see the prominent north rib.

Descent: walk down class 2 into the Big Arroyo and around to Kaweah Gap.

or... At class 3, it is also possible to top out, head down towards the Big Arroyo and hop over the NE ridge of Eagle Scout and drop back to Precipice Lk. Little bit shorter this way, but involves moreÂ scrambling & route finding.
